    • Method Detail

      • getDidPresentIntent

        protected abstract android.content.Intent getDidPresentIntent()
        Returns:
        - the Intent that primer will use when we are finished with the primer experience. Note: this will not be fired if the user cancels the experience (presses back enough times)

      • getDidNotPresentIntent

        protected abstract android.content.Intent getDidNotPresentIntent()
        Returns:
        - the Intent that primer will use when the primer experience is finished, and there has been no user signedup/logged in yet.

      • getSplashLayoutResId

        protected abstract int getSplashLayoutResId()
        Returns:
        - the layout resource to show while Primer is initializing. This will be the first thing the user see's. It should resemble a splash screen

      • handleExperienceError

        public void handleExperienceError(@NonNull
                                  ExperienceError error)
        Description copied from interface: ExperienceCallback
        An error occurred with the experience, most likely due to a misconfiguration. Will pass down the error type so the caller can determine what to do. Typically this will just close the enclosing Activity because we don't know what to do
        Specified by:
        handleExperienceError in interface ExperienceCallback
        Parameters:
        error - - ExperienceError of what went wrong

      • validateFields

        public void validateFields(Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap,
                           ValidationCallback validationResultCallback)
        To validate all input fields on a screen implement the validateUniqueFields method. It gets called after a screen is submitted. The Map contains all input fields on the Screen You MUST call the completion methods on the callback when finished. It is an asynchronous callback. Primer will be showing a loading overlay until you do this
        Specified by:
        validateFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - - a Map of all of the input fields.
        validationResultCallback - - the callback to hit when you are finished

      • signUpWithFields

        public void signUpWithFields(@NonNull
                             Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap,
                             UserValidationCallback callback)
        When a signup flow is submitted, our code calls this method. The Map contains all fields of the flow. Note that the non-sensitive fields get added as user properties after a successful validation. You MUST call the completion methods on the callback when finished. It is an asynchronous callback. Primer will be showing a loading overlay until you do this
        Specified by:
        signUpWithFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - - a Map of all of the input fields.
        callback - - The Callback to hit when signup is complete. You must pass in a unique identifier String if it was a success

      • logInWithFields

        public void logInWithFields(@NonNull
                            Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap,
                            UserValidationCallback callback)
        When a login flow is submitted, our code calls this method. The Map contains all fields of the flow. Note that the non-sensitive fields get added as user properties after a successful validation. You MUST call the completion methods on the callback when finished. It is an asynchronous callback. Primer will be showing a loading overlay until you do this
        Specified by:
        logInWithFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - - a Map of all of the input fields.
        callback - - The Callback to hit when login is complete. You must pass in a unique identifier String if it was a success

      • recoverPasswordsWithFields

        public void recoverPasswordsWithFields(@NonNull
                                       Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap,
                                       ResetPasswordCallback callback)
        When a recover password flow is submitted, our code calls this method. The Map contains all fields of the flow. Note that the non-sensitive fields get added as user properties after a successful validation. You MUST call the completion methods on the callback when finished. It is an asynchronous callback. Primer will be showing a loading overlay until you do this
        Specified by:
        recoverPasswordsWithFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - - a Map of all of the input fields.
        callback - - the callback to hit when the reset password task is complete.

      • authenticateFacebookWithFields

        public void authenticateFacebookWithFields(@NonNull
                                           Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap,
                                           UserValidationCallback callback)
        Called after a Facebook authentication takes place. The Map contains all fields of the flow. Note that the non-sensitive fields get added as user properties after a successful validation. You should validate the fields and call the completion block as soon as possible.
        Specified by:
        authenticateFacebookWithFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - The JSONObject containing user properties that was received from Facebook and all fields of the flow.
        callback - The callback to call when you finished validation. Attention: Always call the `completion` block, even if in an asynchronous manner. Until you do so, the SDK displays a loading overlay to the user.

      • willCloseWithFields

        public void willCloseWithFields(@NonNull
                                Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap)
        Called before the experience will be closed if there was no signup or log in.
        Specified by:
        willCloseWithFields in interface PrimerValidationCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - The `key : value` pair of fields that were put in by the user up until this point in the flow.

      • handlePurchaseRequested

        public void handlePurchaseRequested(PrimerPurchase purchaseInfo)
        Override this to implement purchase behavior. Be sure to call one of the 3 purchase related completion methods when you are finished processing the purchase request. ClientExperienceCallbacks.purchaseComplete(), ClientExperienceCallbacks.purchaseCancelled(), or ClientExperienceCallbacks.purchaseFailed(String, int)
        Specified by:
        handlePurchaseRequested in interface ExperienceCallback
        Parameters:
        purchaseInfo - - The information about the purchase (product id, etc)

      • handleFields

        public void handleFields(@NonNull
                         Map<String,Object> allFieldsMap)
        Override to receive the fields from the 'Submit Fields' Action. Be sure to call one of the 2 completion methods to continue with the flow. ClientExperienceCallbacks.fieldsHandled(boolean) , or ClientExperienceCallbacks.fieldsHandledAdvanceToScreen(String, boolean, boolean)'
        Specified by:
        handleFields in interface ExperienceCallback
        Parameters:
        allFieldsMap - - a Map of all of the input fields.

      • purchaseComplete

        public final void purchaseComplete()
        call this method when the purchase is completed and successful.
        Specified by:
        purchaseComplete in interface ClientExperienceCallbacks

      • purchaseCancelled

        public final void purchaseCancelled()
        call this method when the purchase is cancelled.
        Specified by:
        purchaseCancelled in interface ClientExperienceCallbacks

      • purchaseFailed

        public final void purchaseFailed(@Nullable
                                 String message,
                                 int errorCode)
        call this method when the purchase failed
        Specified by:
        purchaseFailed in interface ClientExperienceCallbacks

      • fieldsHandled

        public final void fieldsHandled(boolean success)
        Clients should call back into this after they are finished processing the fields from the 'Submit Fields' action. If success, the Flow will continue and the success action will be executed. If not, we will hide the validation view and not perform any action.
        Specified by:
        fieldsHandled in interface ClientExperienceCallbacks
        Parameters:
        success - - whether or not the fields were successfully validated. If true, the primer SDK will perform the success action

      • fieldsHandledAdvanceToScreen

        public final void fieldsHandledAdvanceToScreen(String screenName,
                                               boolean clearBackStack,
                                               boolean animateEnter)
        This method is an advanced option for advancing to a specific screen after the fields have been submitted. This can take in a name of a screen that is further in the flow (in the case you want to skip a few more screens). You can also configure whether or not you want to clear the back stack once the new Controller is added. (if the user presses back after this, they will leave the activity). Another configuration option is whether or not to animate in the new view.
        Specified by:
        fieldsHandledAdvanceToScreen in interface ClientExperienceCallbacks
        Parameters:
        screenName - - String defining which Screen should be displayed in the flow.
        clearBackStack - - Whether or not to clear the existing controllers from the stack.
        animateEnter - - Whether or not to animate the new View
